channel.title: Dietrich Ayala
channel.description: Internet freedom, the web and Mozilla.

item.title: RDF Eye Opener
item.description:
Great snippet from Eric van der Vlist on XML-DEV:

"RDF and its triples is really lightweight when you have the right tools to manipulate them. I like to think of them as a RDBMS with a variable geometry: each "row" (ie each subject) can have a variable number of columns (properties). It's like a RDBMS which you could populate before having written any schema, that's really very flexible and it's just a matter of using the right tool. When I use such a tool, I have a feeling of RDBMS without its straitjacket :-) ..."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: I'm Not 30 Yet!
item.description:
"Early 30s is a great time to be alive- you're still young, but you have experience. A powerful combo.

The downside is all that weird rockstar shit you believe about yourself is well past its sell-by date, and if you haven't outgrown it by then, it starts to curdle your insides."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Another PHP/SOAP Article Using NuSOAP
item.description: Devshed article using NuSOAP to access the Amazon SOAP service.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Semantic "Databases" Explained.
item.description: Russel Beattie found this bit by Tim Berners Lee, explaining the semantic web data model by way of mapping it to the relational database model. Very helpful indeed.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: NuSOAP Bugfix Update
item.description: Updated NuSOAP. Fixed some serious WSDL bugs that were in 0.6.3. Recommended update for WSDL users. Download nusoap.php from here.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: NuSOAP Mailing List Started
item.description: I set up a mailing list for NuSOAP at sourceforge.net. Click here to join.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Rescuing XSLT from Niche Status
item.description: "As a programmer with more than 20 years experience with over a dozen languages, XSLT templates and default rules were not obvious to me. Over the past year or two I had looked at numerous examples trying to discern how they worked. While I could understand the general gist of what was occurring, there was too much implied behavior that I did not pick up. It was not until going through formal XSLT training that I fully understood how XSLT worked. Clearly, if the barrier to entry is that high for an experienced programmer, the average web developer was not going to find this technology very useful."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: NuSOAP 0.6.3 Released!
item.description:
NuSOAP 0.6.3 is available now. Has WSDL generation, and lots of bug fixes. Got it a wee bit smaller too :)

Download the nusoap.php file from Sourceforge CVS: http://cvs.sourceforge.net/cgi-bin/viewcvs.cgi/nusoap/lib/.

UPDATE: Here's an example of using the WSDL generation functionality: http://dietrich.ganx4.com/nusoap/testbed/round2_base_server.phps.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: SpamAssassin and POP3Proxy Changed My Life
item.description: OK, now I can't say I hate Perl anymore: POP3Proxy allows Windows users a super easy way to use SpamAssassin with Outlook [Express] or any other POP3 mail client. I usually get (no joke) 150-200 junk emails a day, and now I get about 10!!
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Good List of References for Application Design Patterns
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Mozilla + XSLT
item.description:
Code snippet from Sjeord Fischer on the OPML-DEV list:

var xslProcessor = new XSLTProcessor();

var outputDoc = document.implementation.createDocument("text/xml", "", null);

xslProcessor.transformDocument(xmlNode, xslNode, outputDoc, null);

(code taken from Q42's Mozilla2IE converter for Xopus, available at

xopus.org)

Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Another Apple Article Using NuSOAP!
item.description: This is the second article on the Apple Developer Connection site using NuSOAP. This article is an introduction to implementing Web services with PHP, and uses NuSOAP for it's examples.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Amazon Web Services Uses NuSOAP!
item.description: Very cool: I checked out Amazon's web services out today for the first time (hey, I've been busy!), and noticed that their PHP example in the SDK uses NuSOAP.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala
